page.title: 08WANSBOROUGH PAPER MILL
page.content: { WANSBROUGH PAPER MILL} In Wansbrough Paper Mill they make brown and white paper. 220 men work there and 30 women. They make envelopes, paper bags, wallpaper, sugar bags and paper for packaging. They are open 7 days a week and 10 days off at Christmas. They have two cooks. The paper goes to the Midlands. They have 25 lorries owned by Griggs and 75 trailers. They got 2 million pounds in 1984. The lorries carry 20 tonnes. They have got two big machines. They gave us a drink and something to eat. Once the paper mill was owned by some Americans but now it is owned by English people. The paper mill is very dangerous because of the hot wax they have and it is very big. {By Sarah Lynch
